content.raw:
@{557058:d30370f4-284a-4762-a32f-25b280051754} , thank you, that’s what we needed to know.  I see that you’re using the following:

 Kubernetes GPU \(Worker\) Nodes: `ami-0884e51dacccc6d23`, name `preyna-ubuntu-18_04-CUDA_10_1-nvidia-docker_2-kubernetes_1_14-v0.2.1`. Used with `g3s.xlarge` instances.

We’re a little new to running docker containers on AWS instances, but it looks like CUDA 10.1 is being used on a g3s.xlarge instance, so we’ll try to set up our docker container such that it runs on that configuration.  Much appreciated.
content.html:
@Alejo Carballude , thank you, that’s what we needed to know. I see that you’re using the following:

Kubernetes GPU (Worker) Nodes: ami-0884e51dacccc6d23, name preyna-ubuntu-18_04-CUDA_10_1-nvidia-docker_2-kubernetes_1_14-v0.2.1. Used with g3s.xlarge instances.

We’re a little new to running docker containers on AWS instances, but it looks like CUDA 10.1 is being used on a g3s.xlarge instance, so we’ll try to set up our docker container such that it runs on that configuration. Much appreciated.
